alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Piscataquis; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 5:05PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of North Central, Northern, and WEST CENTRAL Maine, including the following counties, in North Central Maine, Piscataquis. In Northern Maine, Aroostook. In WEST CENTRAL Maine, Somerset. * WHEN...Until 815 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 505 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clayton Lake, Baker Lake, Billy-Jack Depot and Nine-mile Bridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
